headline: Spinach and Feta Turkey Burgers
description: These spinach and feta turkey burgers are moist and easy to make in one bowl with simple ingredients, shaped into patties, and cooked on a hot grill.
name: Spinach and Feta Turkey Burgers
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 ounce) box frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Mix together turkey, spinach, feta, eggs, and garlic in a large bowl until well combined; form into 8 patties.

Cook patties on the preheated grill on both sides until no longer pink in the center, 15 to 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of patties should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: This is a great elevated summer burger! I followed other reviewers suggestions and added a sautéed chopped onion & garlic, splash of worcestershire sauce & tobasco. I used Trader Joes Mediterranean seasoned crumbled Feta for an extra boost of flavor. This recipe is a keeper! If you're on Weight Watchers the burgers are 6 points each.

These were delicious on their own. However, I did add a few extras to enhance them. I added diced red onions and lemon juice. I had my husband try them as intended (without modifications) and then with the changes. He liked the latter. I would also encourage serving them with Tzatziki sauce or some hummus. These burgers have great flavor and are delicious, light, and fresh. Definitely having these again!

These were delicious on their own. However, I did add a few extras to enhance them. I added diced red onions and lemon juice. I had my husband try them as intended (without modifications) and then with the changes. He liked the latter. I would also encourage serving them with Tzatziki sauce or some hummus. These burgers have great flavor and are delicious, light, and fresh. Definitely having these again!

We are usually beef burger eaters, but our daughter was home from college and doesn't love beef, so we tried these turkey burgers. They are FANTASTIC. If you're not familiar with Tzatziki sauce, give it a try! It's a creamy Greek cucumber sauce that is simple to make but sooo good.
Wow! Soooo tasty and a nice, healthy change from regular burgers. Finished them off with bbq sauce on the bun, lettuce and onions (forgot to get a tomato)
This was okay. My family asked that I make my lamb burgers instead. So I won’t make it again. Would rather make lamb burgers and spanakopita.

I made these exactly as written. They were delicious, held together and grilled beautifully. The turkey mixture is soft and sticky so I patted the patties out onto squares of parchment. This made flipping them onto a preheated grill so easy. I served them t
Eee I just got
These are great. We serve then on pita bread with Tzatziki sauce. Yum!

Love this recipe. Easy to make a delicious every time. I used fresh spinach instead of frozen, cooked in frying pan, used paper towel to absorb moisture, then cut into smaller pieces with kitchen sheers
I'll make this again. Best Turkey Burger ever!
The flavor was good, but it needed a binder. I added a lot of panko crumbs, along with paprika and fresh basil.

I fixed these burgers for dinner tonight and they were great. I bought 85/15 ground turkey and instead of plain feta, I used feta mixed with sun dried tomatoes and basil. Added all the other ingredients per the recipe. The raw mixture was pretty loose (maybe my spinach was too wet) so I pan fried the burgers. Next time I might use chopped raw spinach, or add some bread crumbs to absorb the excess moisture. used hearty rolls, topped the burgers with lettuce tomatoes and tzatziki sauce. Yummy. BTW, my guys who usually eat 2 burgers could only finish 1 of these. The recipe made 5.
Love em’, I used fresh spinach, 1/2 C onion and one teaspoon of Detroit Greektown seasoning. They were great.

Delicious burger! I used fresh spinach and chopped it finely. Also, I added one slice of whole wheat bread torn to the meat mixture to help hold it together. I also added some finely chopped onion to the mixture. Hubbs brushed some olive oil to both sides before putting on the grill. They were absolutely delicious and juicy. It was really nice with a dollup of taziki sauce on grilled whole wheat buns. GREAT recipe!
easy and awesome
This was just okay. I didn't like the flavor of the frozen spinach and found it overwhelming to the bland turkey. I would make this again with ground beef and fresh spinach.
Wow!!! Delicious!!! I did use fresh spinach. Next time think I’ll add more feta but besides that we loved them!!!! Can’t wait to make them again

I don't eat turkey so I did it with marinated tofu (crumbled). It came out great! 
a long time ago there was a burrito place near me that had the biggest burritoes I have ever seen, sadly they are gone. But their marinated tofu recipe survived.
I got this from them before they closed:
Tofu marinated in orange juice and chopped chipotle peppers (rehydrated dried peppers then chopped). salt & pepper to taste with some oil (I like a bit of sesame oil). Marinate overnight crush it up and mix with this recipe.
cooked and crumbled Tempeh would also work with this recipe.
The family enjoyed this recipe. We combined with the tzatziki sauce recipe from here and it was just perfect. Ate them on homemade rolls. We will definitely have this again!
This is a household favorite with all of my kids. I add Worcestershire and paprika while the patties are cooking, and it comes out great!

these are simply scrumptious! Halved the recipe but with 4 oz. of feta. I did grate fresh onion, about 1/4 of an onion. Also added garlic powder, onion powder, dried oregano, 1 t. Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. Put it all in the fridge for an hour and then fried them in olive oil. Full of flavor!!

I like many others used fresh spinach. I also put the bowl of "mixed up" burger mixture in the fridge for 30 minutes and then made the patties and put them in the freezer for about an hour. I used a non-stick skillet and olive oil and they browned up nicely and stayed together well. Served with grilled red onions, chopped cucumbers, and Tzatziki sauce (Chef Johns) on whole wheat pita bread. Loved it and will make again.

Made these into meatballs, which I cooked in the oven at 350 for 20 minutes but they should get broiled at the end for a darker coating. Reminder that I need full 2 lbs of turkey to feed our family of 4.

Delicious! I had fresh spinach so I used that sautéed with the garlic. I also chopped up some mini bell peppers and added to the sauté, then after cooled added to the other ingredients. I just pan fried them and they were delicious. Love these!!
have made it numerous times. Big hit here and healthy
These are fantastic. Always a hit at my house. Serve with tzatziki, red onion, cucumbers, a green leaf lettuce. Yum!

Added worcestshire sauce, paprika and chopped sundried tomatoes. I refrigerated them for an hour as some suggested but they were still very hard to handle. Next time I will try freezing them half way. Served with tzatziki sauce from this site. My husband and I loved them!
Great flavor, but fell apart on the grill
I made this recipe as directed, but cut it in half. The feta cheese totally overwhelmed the taste. Perhaps another cheese would be a better choice. I love feta, but not in this recipe.
surprised it was really, really delicioua

I used half the amount of the ingredients, and was able to make 8 good sized patties. Ate the patties with a salad (of chopped up red onion, tomato, cucumber, and jalapeno), kalamata olives, hummus, and whole wheat naan. It was delicious.

Wow, these are so good. Made just as the recipe was written.
Delicious.

These are delicious! I skipped making tzatziki sauce but used a good dollop of greek yogurt on top. I'm always a little heavy on the garlic. These had great flavor without being over powering. I cooked them inside on my stovetop instead of grilling. I will definitely try these again!

Wonderful! For more detailed grilling instructions: freeze for 20 minutes first. Grill at 450 9 minutes on the first side, then flip and grill for another 6. Carefully spray the grate with cooking spray before putting on.

These tasted very good but, despite refrigerating the turkey mix for about 2 hours first, I had such as hard time shaping these into patties. The mix was just too mushy. I used an organic ground turkey from Costco and it was a soft ground turkey to begin with so that may have been my problem. There was no way these would have survived the grill so I made them on a non-stick pan on the stove. They firmed up fine once cooked but I literally had to gab a handful of the meat mixture and plop it on the pan then try to flatten it while on the pan. It was so sticky that it stuck to my hands too which made flattening it difficult. Served it on tortillas with tzatziki sauce, sliced cucumbers and spinach leaves. I told my husband and two sons that I would not make this again and they all groaned and asked me please to make it again. I couldn't believe it. They loved it therefore I will try again and use a different turkey meat. Maybe that was my problem. BTW I did saute the garlic ( I don't like raw garlic) with a little onion and I used chopped baby spinach instead of frozen which I sauteed just a few seconds.
6/2019 - Very good, easy to pull together and cook up on the stove. Great flavor, tasted healthy, everyone liked it. I prefer the greek turkey burgers recipe on here over this one, tho.
Absolutely loved this recipe!
These turned out great! I added a little worchestershire and extra garlic. Will make them again.

I had bought some turkey burger, as I was in the habit of cooking up turkey chili, but the chili weather is gone now, and it's summer time, so I was trying to find a recipe that would spark up the turkey, and I chose this one. I wan't expecting much, as making a tasty turkey burger requires a lot. Well, I was pleasantly surprised, and the flavor of this burger was so good! I used canned spinach because I didn't have frozen, and I halved the recipe because I had just a pound of turkey. It had to be the combination of the spinach, the feta cheese and garlic that gave it such a delicious flavor. I didn't have the ingredients for the topping, so I just used a buttermilk dressing. I froze the rest, but saved another for tomorrow! Soooo good!!

I had bought some turkey burger, as I was in the habit of cooking up turkey chili, but the chili weather is gone now, and it's summer time, so I was trying to find a recipe that would spark up the turkey, and I chose this one. I wan't expecting much, as making a tasty turkey burger requires a lot. Well, I was pleasantly surprised, and the flavor of this burger was so good! I used canned spinach because I didn't have frozen, and I halved the recipe because I had just a pound of turkey. It had to be the combination of the spinach, the feta cheese and garlic that gave it such a delicious flavor. I didn't have the ingredients for the topping, so I just used a buttermilk dressing. I froze the rest, but saved another for tomorrow! Soooo good!!
Made these on Memorial Day, was a hit all around; will definitely make these again THANKS allrecipes!
Absolutely delicious! So easy to prepare. I substituted a Feta Dill salad dressing as a topper, and it was spectacular
I really enjoyed this recipe & made a few changes - used only 1lb of Ground Turkey, added Wicked Juicy Burger Kitchen Accomplice.

I don't have an outdoor grill, so I cooked the patties on a George Foreman grill instead; most of them fell apart on me. I would recommend anyone who lacks an outdoor grill to use a cast iron skillet as a substitute. Fry the patties in olive oil when using this equipment.

My kids liked this burger, so that's good; it will go into the rotation, but I thought it was a bit bland as written for my taste. I will add smoked paprika and more garlic next time. I served them on whole-wheat pitas with home made tzatziki.
Made these according to the recipe. Very good! Moist and full of flavor, simple and easy. Will absolutely be making these again.
These are incredible!
These are incredible!
I made these with ground chicken because i didn’t have turkey. They were delicious and very easy. My fiancé prefers beef but loved these. We will definitely make them again!
Great recipe! I am not a fan of ground turkey but love this!

I made this recipe and it came out so tasty. I added chopped onions, green and red peppers, and cooked mushrooms. My dressing of choice was honey mustard and a little bit of mayo. For bread, I used Naan bread nicely toasted. It was so delicious that we are eating the same thing tomorrow since I had enough meet leftover.

OMG!! These we're so good! I did change a couple of things. I used fresh spinach and garlic. I also added little bit of breadcrumbs. I most definitely will make these again! Thank you for sharing your recipe!
A good recipe, healthy etc. wish it was a little more moist; so I’ll experiment more! I love the ingredients including spinach and feta cheese. I’ll definitely make it again!????
My family and I enjoyed this interesting take on burgers. I added extra garlic and chopped spinach.
Love it! I'm not a big fan of spinach but Feta cheese helped in the overall taste......this is healthy eating
Juicy and tasty made per the recipe except halved all ingredients because we only needed 4 burgers.

Excellent burgers! I followed the recipe with the exception of using fresh spinach (about 8 oz's) and (6 oz's) of crumbled feta cheese. 
My husband normally does not like turkey burgers but loved these. They were moist and flavorful without the need to add salt. I will be making them again soon.
These burgers were epic! So good and so healthy. Thanks for the share. Just added more garlic. Amazing. Will be making again and again - less red meat is a win in our house.

These were very flavorful and tender. Turkey can be dry but the cheese sort of melted and countered the dryness. I usually don't like feta cheese, but in the turkey burgers it added flavor and a cream texture. No need to add salt, feta is salty enough.
Tried grilling these and they came out terrible. The meat did not hold together well on the grill.
I added feta and frozen kale. Ah-ma-zing!!! Cooked the burgers on indoor grill doing quarter turns every three minutes four times (12minutes). Garnished with arugula and tomato slice.
Awesome, loved them
AWESOME
this was an outstanding recipe. I only added poblano peppers to give it a little kick

Flavor is outstanding easy to make and healthy dish. I will make it again
Will share with family and friends.

Flavor is outstanding easy to make and healthy dish. I will make it again
Will share with family and friends.
Baked at 400° for 30 minutes on parchment paper and added red pepper flakes. Kronos pita bread bun replacement. Definitely one I'd make again.
Very easy and great flavor.

These were so good! I misread the recipe and added 4 eggs. I thought I was doubling it, but it already called for two pounds of Turkey so I added about 1/2 cup of panko to dry it up a bit. I also had fresh spinach on hand and used that. My husband loved them also.
Made as written and was very pleased with the burgers. Not dry and very tasty. I rolled them in bread crumbs before frying them on the stove.
Followed recipe exactly but baked at 350° F for 30 minutes instead of hrilling. I served these on warm pitas with tzatziki sauce. It was delicious!
Great burger my two year old tiny granddaughter just crushed three quarters of a burger. Healthy choice as well.
Even the people who dislike ground turkey loved it.
Even the people who dislike ground turkey loved it.
Delicious and so easy! I think the feta helps keep them moist ! Cooked in a cast iron pan instead of the stove - added a little salt & pepper.
Delicious!
Absolutely yummy and quick!
Eh.
This recipe is great as written with both turkey or beef!
Very good, added French Thyme, sea salt, pepper, & Sun dried tomatoes, pan fried with just butter spray.
Excellent thanks for sharing
I love these! They are easy, taste really fantastic and are heart healthy. Great recipe.

Made as directed, it was tasty but too dense to my liking. Next time I cooked, I just beat egg whites till their foam held its shape and folded into meat, which greatly improved texture for me. Cooked with thermometer till ready. Adding feta to a burger was a brilliant idea that I have adapted for a meatloaf and sausage variations of this recipe. Having cooked this several times, I sometimes add a tsp of lime or lemon juice to brighten it up. Thank you for the idea.
My boys loved this burger. They are learning to food prep and these have so few ingredients. Bought the sauce and sliced cucumbers for the week. Ate them for lunch every day. :)

Followed recipe exactly first time making these, they were good but needed a little something. Second time making I followed others reviewers suggestions and added extra garlic, chopped onion and worstershire sauce, as well as a bit of salt & pepper. Served on naan bread with Tzatziki sauce. This has become a favorite at our house!
So yummy! No changes and so happy!

I made this recently for dinner and it was a huge hit. Definitely a keeper. Instead of using the frozen spinach I sautéed fresh spinach in a skillet with olive oil, kosher salt, and fresh ground pepper. I let it cool completely then chopped it up before adding it to the meat mixture.

I like the recipe with additional seasoning.
It is good but bland, you need to add any seasoning, heat you desire that will give the burgers a nice pop.
I cooked a couple of burgers for tasting and added seasoning to the remaining uncooked mixture.
Will make again

Excellent. Nice change from the usual burger. I followed recipe exactly. It made 8 burgers and I froze 4. The frozen ones cooked great a couple of weeks later. The meat mix is mushy but firms up well when cooked. I used a grill mat because I wasn’t sure how well they would turn. They turned fine but I will continue to use the mat to avoid flare ups as they do drip a bit. They cook towards the lower time, I would say 7 minutes on each side. Served in a pocket with tzaziki and lettuce. Yum!
Will make again
Not a lot of flavor. Had to add salt, pepper, more garlic. I also had to add a cup of bread crumbs to keep the meat from falling apart.

These turkey burgers turned out great. I was a little apprehensive about them holding together as the mix was quite mushy. Cooked up beautifully. I did cook them in oven due to thunder storm . Made according to recipe. Eight good sized burgers. I did not need eight but made extra to put in freezer. Easy to put together. Definitely a keeper.

We thought these burgers were absolutely delicious! Like others, I sautéed the spinach with a small amount of diced onion and the garlic before adding to the meat mixture. I served them in pita bread, with tzatziki sauce, lettuce, and tomato. We will definitely make them again!

I have made this twice for the holidays and everyone loved it ! The only real changes I made was to season the fround turkey with a few additional spices and use hickory chips when bbq for a hint of smokey flavor

I’ve made these a few times and we’ve loved them! I used ground turkey that had been frozen and was a little more miost than I preferred when I mixed it with everything else so I needed to use a small amount of bread crumbs to hold the patties nicely together. We always go by less though so I didn’t feel guilty. Topped with some homemade guac and they’re so so good!!
Did have to add some bread crumbs, and used Grill Masters Smoky Montreal Steak seasoning.
I made these burgers last summer for a bbq party. It was a great success. Ever since we are having an outdoor party our friends are requesting these burgers !!!!
